path: Boxes/Temple College Nursing Program/LVN Program/Summer 24/Clinical Lvn Training/Documents/KEY Dosage Calculation Assignment Practice.docx
text: Name _______________________________________ Dosage Calculations Practice *Terms must be spelled correctly to receive credit. 1)	What do the following abbreviations stand for? A)	po	__by mouth__________	B) mL ____milliliter_________________ 2)	During a 0700 to 1900 shift, a client has NS infusing at 100 mL/h for 5 hours. The client consumes 8 oz of broth and 8 oz of water at 0800 & 4 oz of tea at 1300. At the end of your shift, the client’s Foley catheter is emptied of 550 mL of urine and the wound vac has 200 mL of drainage. A)	What is the client’s total intake this shift? _____1100 mL_______________ B)	What is the client’s total output this shift? ______750 mL_______________ *Remember to round to the nearest tenth, round IV problems to the nearest whole number and label all your final answers. 3)	A health care provider orders Augmentin 500 mg po daily. The nurse has the following on hand:	 How many tablets will the nurse administer? ________2 tablets___________________ 4)	A health care provider orders phenobarbital 45 mg po two times a day. Phenobarbital elixir 20 mg/5 mL is available. How many milliliters will the nurse administer? ______11.3 mL_______________ 5)	A health care provider orders synthroid 0.025 mg po daily. The nurse has the following on hand? How many tablets will the nurse administer? _________1 tablet_____________ 6)	A health care provider orders Halcion 0.25 mg po at bedtime. The nurse has Halcion 0.125 mg tablets on hand. How many tablets will the nurse administer? _____2 tablets_______________ 7)	Order: NS 1500 mL to infuse over 7 hours. Drop factor = 20 gtt/mL. How many mL/h? ________214 mL/h____________________ How many gtt/min? _______71 gtt/min__________________ 8)	The health care provider orders 250 mL of D5W to infuse over 2 hours. Drop factor = 60 gtt/mL. How many mL/h? _______125 mL/h_____________________ How many gtt/min? ______125 gtt/min__________________ 9)	A client with anasarca has albumin 25% 125 mL ordered over 30 minutes. The drop factor is 15 gtt/mL. How many mL/h? __________250 mL/h__________________ How many gtt/min? _________63 gtt/min_________________ 10)	A client with IV immunoglobulin G (IgG) 100 mL ordered over 3 hours. Drop factor is 10 gtt/mL. How many mL/h? ________33 mL/h____________________ How many gtt/min? ______6 gtt/mn____________________
